Specific Details: Meeting with Deputy Pa Daly to discuss penal reform priorities
Subject Matter: Meeting with Deputy Pa Daly to discuss penal reform priorities

Emails to arrange this meeting. |Email|2-5::IPRT's Executive Director, Saoirse Brady, and Legal & Public Affairs Manager, Helen Kehoe, met Deputy Daly (online) on 25 Oct 2023, to discuss penal reform priorities such as: the need for sentencing guidelines, alternatives to imprisonment (Community Service Orders, restorative justice), accountability in the penal system, the ratification of OPCAT; the IPRT children & family initiative, etc.|Meeting|1::IPRT's Legal & Public Affairs Manager sent a follow up email to Deputy Daly after the meeting to provide more information on key penal reform issues that were discussed at the meeting.|Email|1

Specific Details: Engagement with Deputy Daly regarding issues of penal reform
Subject Matter: Engagement with Deputy Daly regarding issues of penal reform
Intended Results: To inform the Deputy of penal reform priorities of IPRT, with a view to securing support for penal reform.
Lobbying Activities: Email from Saoirse Brady, Executive Director, to Deputy Daly, on 10 November, providing information on penal reform priorities, including matters such as the Sub-Committee Report on Penal Reform 2013, current prison population numbers, the Review of Policy Options for Prison & Penal Reform 2022-2024, and IPRT press releases re the Annual Reports of the IPS and the Probation Service.|Email|1

Specific Details: Meeting with Deputy Pa Daly to discuss penal reform priorities.
Subject Matter: Meeting with Deputy Pa Daly to discuss penal reform priorities.
Intended Results: To secure support from the Deputy for IPRT's key penal reform priorities and developments in penal reform generally - in the context of political party manifestos being in preparation at this time.
Lobbying Activities: IPRT's Executive Director, Saoirse Brady, and Legal & Public Affairs Manager, Helen Kehoe, met Deputy Daly on 17 April (online), to discuss penal reform priorities such as: extension of the Bail Supervision Scheme, extension of the Prison & In-Courts Liaison Service, women in prison, spent convictions and the need for legislation, and voting in prison.|Virtual Meeting|1::Follow up email - to provide more information on key matters discussed during meeting and to flag IPRT's concerns in more detail - sent by Helen Kehoe on 18 April to Deputy Daly. |Email|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Saoirse Brady, Executive Director, IPRT and Helen Kehoe, Legal & Public Affairs Manager, IPRT

Lobbyist Name: Committee on the Administration of Justice
Specific Details: Joint CAJ-ICCL Policing Project
Subject Matter: Joint CAJ-ICCL Policing Project
Intended Results: We aimed to brief Sinn Féin's Justice Spokesperson on the joint CAJ-ICCL project focused on policing oversight, supported by Community Foundation Ireland through the All-Island Fund. The aim was to update Sinn Féin on our policy priorities in policing and strengthen engagement on this critical issue.
Lobbying Activities:
We met with Pa Daly T.D., Sinn Féin’s Justice Spokesperson, in Dundalk to provide a detailed briefing on the joint work between CAJ and ICCL on policing oversight. The collaboration, funded by the Community Foundation Ireland through the All-Island Fund, aims to address key issues surrounding policing practices across the island of Ireland. During the meeting, we outlined the project's objectives, highlighted current challenges in the policing landscape, and shared our policy priorities.
|Meeting|1
